name: Arvalus
sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.

attributes.attribute: equated with Arvalus by the invading Romans
divinities associated with the name Apollo
a place where Arvalus may have once ruled

text: Continental Celtic deity Arvalus was associated with healing and was identified by Romans as an equivalent of Apollo. It is possible that the name Arvalus once presided over a sanctuary of thermal springs, as this term was frequently used for divine figures in such locations.
